title: Train yolov3 on  4 channel RGB-D images.
body:
Hello everyone,

I have two datasets consisting of RGB images(3 channel) and Depth images(1 channel). I fused both datasets and created 4 channel images i.e. RGB-D images. Now I want to train yolov3 on this dataset. What are the changes that I need to do in order to train my model?

I already updated channels=4 in yolo config file. I am getting the following error when I start training:

```
raceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 423, in <module>
    train()  # train normally
  File "train.py", line 262, in train
    pred = model(imgs)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 532, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/models.py", line 235, in forward
    return self.forward_once(x)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/models.py", line 289, in forward_once
    x = module(x)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 532, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/container.py", line 100, in forward
    input = module(input)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 532, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/conv.py", line 345, in forward
    return self.conv2d_forward(input, self.weight)
  File "/home/rajat/Desktop/Radspot/Object_detection/yolov3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/conv.py", line 342, in conv2d_forward
    self.padding, self.dilation, self.groups)
RuntimeError: Given groups=1, weight of size 32 3 3 3, expected input[32, 4, 512, 512] to have 3 channels, but got 4 channels instead

```
